titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lee Wulff Papers
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:27

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Lee Wulff Papers contain drafts, setting copies, and proofs of books, and drafts of magazine articles and reports by Wulff, with related correspondence and reviews; correspondence and related printed material; biographical clippings and obituaries; photographs of Wulff and his family, and photographs of early paintings by him; and flies and fly lines made by Wulff or designed by him. Research strengths include Wulff's writings on fishing, hunting, and conservation; catch and release fishing; fly fishing techniques, equipment, education, and the Wulff School of Fly Fishing; Wulff's design and marketing of fly fishing equipment, and Royal Wulff Products; hunting and fishing in Newfoundland and Labrador; conservation of the Atlantic salmon; and hunting, fishing, and conservation organizations in the United States and Canada, 1930s-1990s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Joan Wulff on the Jonathan O. Bulkley Fund, 2005; and gift of Joan Wulff, 2008-2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 21 (objects): Restricted fragile material. Reference images may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Lee Wulff Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lee Wulff Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of materials formerly classed as Uncat MSS 802, Uncat MSS 1060, and Uncat MSS 1241. In 2013, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including partial rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, materials were organized into series, and containers were renumbered in a single sequence. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the donor, while some were assigned by Library staff. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

bioghist.head: Lee Wulff (1905-1991)
bioghist.p: Fly fisher, author, conservationist, artist, and filmmaker. Wulff invented fly fishing techniques and equipment, advocated catch and release fishing and Atlantic salmon conservation, and popularized fishing and hunting through his writings and films. He married Joan Salvato Wulff (1926-), fly fisher and author, with whom he founded the Wulff School of Fly Fishing, on the Beaverkill River, New York, in 1979, and Royal Wulff Products, a fly fishing equipment business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lee Wulff Papers contain drafts, setting copies, and proofs of books, and drafts of magazine articles and reports by Wulff, with related correspondence and reviews; correspondence and related printed material; biographical clippings and obituaries; photographs of Wulff and his family, and photographs of early paintings by him; and flies and fly lines made by Wulff or designed by him. Research strengths include Wulff's writings on fishing, hunting, and conservation; catch and release fishing; fly fishing techniques, equipment, education, and the Wulff School of Fly Fishing; Wulff's design and marketing of fly fishing equipment, and Royal Wulff Products; hunting and fishing in Newfoundland and Labrador; conservation of the Atlantic salmon; and hunting, fishing, and conservation organizations in the United States and Canada, 1930s-1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Writings, 1938-1999. II. Correspondence and Subject Files, 1930s-2005. III. Photographs, 1914-1988. IV. Objects, undated.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: DVDs in box 14: â€¡a Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Books, Magazine Articles, and Other Writings. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically by title, followed by unsorted materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings concern fly fishing, hunting, and conservation, some with related correspondence, photographs, or research materials.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional correspondence is in Series I, Writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain mostly correspondence; also present are notes, clippings, and other printed material. Correspondents include publishers, fly fishing equipment businesses, fishing and conservation organizations, friends, colleagues, and fans. Some files contain biographical information, family correspondence, or other family papers.
